author: jbenet.
content: - Yeah, it was in one part because we didnt have a solution to SSLE 3 years ago, and also because we think we can get more throughput with tipsets (though right now the binding constraint is verification time, not propagation delay -- once we make verification faster, we expect propagation delay to be a bigger problem)

author: jbenet.
content:
- <@!273808422753796097>  Yes! we've seen some of the solutions for SSLE -- great work! üëç 
- We may move to using SSLE in next iterations of the chain. we're not using it now because this design got frozen ~1.5yr ago so that we would ship it "soon". 
- We hope to make a bunch of upgrades to consensus in 2021 and 2022, and moving to SSLE is likely one (especially if we dont get any throughput out of tipsets)

author: .vbuterin
content: There definitely are benefits from having parallel proposers; reduced censorship vulnerability is one

author: .vbuterin
content: So if you decide the benefits of parallel proposing exceed the costs, then it may well be the case that SSLE to have a constant proposer count is not worth the complexity
